snippet: When the iPad hit the market, some people predicted that it would wipe out e-reader devices. But Barnes & Noble says its Nook is flourishing.
abstract: Barnes & Noble says sales of Nook e-reader devices rose 70 percent during the nine weeks ended Dec 31, compared with the same period a year earlier; IHS iSuppli estimates Barnes & Noble has 13 percent of the e-reader market after two years in the business, versus 67 percent for Amazon.
lead_paragraph: When the iPad hit the market, some people predicted that it would wipe out e-reader devices. But Barnes & Noble says its Nook is flourishing.

headline.seo: Nook From Barnes & Noble Gains More E-Book Readers
headline.main: Nook From Barnes & Noble Gains More E-Book Readers
headline.print_headline: Nook From Barnes & Noble Gains More E-Book Readers
